content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's an example of how you could implement the function `extract_julia_code`:
```
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    code_blocks = matchall(r"^```julia\s*[\S\s]*?^```$", md)
    return join(code_blocks, "\n")
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to match all the code blocks in the markdown document `md`. The regular expression `^```julia\s*[\S\s]*?^```$` matches a code block that starts with ```julia``` and ends with ````, and includes any number of whitespace characters (`\s`) or non-whitespace characters (`[\S]`) in between. The `^` and `$` anchors ensure that the match is only for entire lines.

The function then joins all the code blocks together with a newline character (`\n`).
